## Quarto Markdown quick examples

### Citations

An example citation [@williams2010pair]. You can also cite @williams2010pair in the text, without the brackets.

This is a reference to a chapter of a book [@TeachProgAcross_C01]. You can find it in `references.bib`; it uses the `@inbook` type.

The "References" section will be populated automatically at the bottom.

### Footnotes

This is some text with a footnote[^C00-myfootnote].

[^C00-myfootnote]: Write the content of your footnote here.

    If you need a multiline footnote, indent the following lines with 4 spaces...

    ...like this. Everything indented will be part of the footnote.

### URL links

Use [link text](https://quarto.org) to include URL links; please refer to the accessibility guidance in the book submission guidelines.

If it is absolutely necessary to display the full URL in the text, use `<...>`: <https://quarto.org>

### Putting some content in a box

:::{.callout-tip icon="false"}
# Title of your box

You can put some content in a box like this, called a [callout](https://quarto.org/docs/authoring/callouts.html), if you want it to be visually distinct from the rest of your chapter. This could be e.g. if you write an example or a short case study.

:::
